div.head: Detection of iron-ligand vibrations in the themally induced high-spin low-spin transition of single-crystalline Fe(tpa)(NCS)2 by angular resol ved nuclear resonant inelastic scattering
Report:
div.p: The complex [Fe(tpa)(NCS)&tpa = tris(2-pyridylmethyl),Xg. 1) with non in the ferrous oxidation state exibits a thermally induced "low-spin" e "high spin" interconversion at a critical temperature T, around 105 K. The transition is suggested to be entropically driven in the manner that the intramolecular vibrations in the high-spin state are softened and give thus rise to a higher vibrational entropy.

div.p: During the measurements it turned out, however, that the energy calibration was unstable so that the very difficile task of working out the differences in the phonon excitation spectrum as a function of the direction of the incoming beam could not be accomplished. After completion of the experiments it was found that the reason for our problems was a broken spring in the bearing of high-resolution monochromator. Thus a repetition of the series of measurements is inevitable.
